ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: about the baroque period of Italian art, helped me talk about art and see details
This course really helped me think about art on a deeper level. Its very enlightening to listen to professor Suthor explain her understanding of art.
I furthered my skills in close-looking and analysis. I learned more about the history of Baroque art and the sociopolitical environment that helped contribute to its style
I learned about the major artists, works, and themes of Baroque art in 17th Century Rome. I also improved my ability to visually analyze an artistic work.
This course gives an amazing survey of all aspects of Baroque art.

Visual analysis of painting, sculpture and architecture in seventeenth-century Rome. How to apply that visual analysis in the form of discussion and written papers. We learned about the characteristics of major artists of the period and style, such as Caravaggio, Poussin and Bernini.
I gained a great deal of skill with regards to visual analysis and critical thinking about art.
So many! wonderful course
I learned major works of Baroque art, sculpture and architecture. For each exam I memorized about 30-50 works of art. I feel as though my visual analysis improved.
I learnt about the characteristics of baroque and how to appreciate architecture! (something I was very vary of before)
Incredible exposure to southern Baroque painting and architecture; ability to communicate about art in new ways.
Knowledge of the different styles and major works/artists of the Baroque period.
I developed a new appreciation for how Baroque art relates to Baroque society, a broader picture of Western art practice, and modern society.
I was able to comprehensively review several figures, artworks, and themes that are pertinent to my art historical specialty.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: strengths: interesting lectures and readings improvements: could have received the set of images that would be on the midterm/final before we lectured on it. it would help give context to what is important, and what is just supporting information
The structure of the class is good. Two lectures a week, each lecture about a different artist or theme, plus a weekly discussion section that applies what we learned in lecture.

Great course! Interesting lectures and Professor Suthor is so kind and knowledgable. At times, I thought the sections were a little unnecessary and could have met every other week instead of every week.
Strengths: interesting material, great professor, really interesting works chosen for analysis in section. Weakness: Hard to make up class, as the lecture slides aren't made available online.

All strengths! This course was amazing. Professor Suthor is both knowledgeable and approachable-- she is the most friendly professor I've had! The curriculum covered a wide breadth of art produced during the Baroque period in Rome. Sections were genuinely instructive, unlike those of many other courses. Readings were manageable, interesting, and relevant. Papers were fun to write and exams were very fair! The trip to the Hartford Wadsworth Atheneum was a major plus-- when given the opportunity to go to an art museum with an expert art historian who truly cares about her students, take it!
Sometimes it is hard to keep up in lecture, it would be helpful if the slides were posted (or at least the quotes) to help us keep track of what was covered when
There is a great deal of memorization that the midterms and finals rely on, but that is inherent itself within the field of art history, so it can't be really avoided I suppose.
Professor Suthor is very talented and knows the content very well. Sometimes I felt like I would have liked more historical context about the period to place the works we were studying.
I wish professor Suthor would upload her slides! It's much easier to study and follow the conversation since most of the names were in italian
Great
I liked how the course incorporated painting, sculpture, and architecture.

This course is engaging and interesting. The biggest strength is just how fascinating the material is and the opportunity the course presents to look at beautiful art. The only suggestion for improving the course is perhaps disseminating a slide list before lecture. Sometimes it is unclear what the title or dates of the works of art are when they are presented.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, very interesting and very good professor

Yes I would highly recommend this class to anyone who is interested in art history! This class really opened my mind to new ways of understanding art in general. It taught me to think critically in a different way from my STEM classes.
Yes! Great course if you are interested in the material.

Yes, this is an excellent art history class, especially if you are interested in Rome or the baroque. Artists like Caravaggio and Bernini are among the most influential in their fields, so it is fun to study them. The workload was low, but the class is engaging, and you learn a lot.

I'd definitely recommend for anyone who's looking to learn more about Baroque art! You definitely don't need any prior knowledge of art history to do well in this course--Professor Suthor will teach you everything you need to know.

I would absolutely recommend! Professor Suthor is so kind and intelligent. The art we studied was beautiful. Rome is one of the most important cities in the world and it is so cool to learn about the art produced during the Baroque period. I always looked forward to my Tuesday and Thursday mornings because of this class. The small size (for a lecture) made the class more engaging, because Professor Suthor would ask us what we thought about the art we looked at.
Yes! It is a good course to learn about really beautiful art
Mos Def.
YES
Yes!
Yes
professor suthor is awesome and the content you cover is incredibly engaging and fun to learn about i would definitely recommend this course to anyone who's even slightly interested in art history!!
If you're interested in the Baroque period, yes.

I would definitely recommend this course! It is intellectually stimulating and has a very fair workload. The expectations for succeeding in the course are clear and the feedback is fair and helpful. The subject matter is interesting.
